Description: Intact pottery jar; one-piece, low-bellied profile with two upturned horizontal handles and slight ring foot; worn painted decoration on body of cross-hatched hour-glass motifs.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context ΦA (Well 1) or ΦB (Well 2) From the bottom of a well
Curator's comments: Mentioned by Gardner, Naukratis II, 43, as having been found at the bottom of a well in the Temenos of Aphrodite. A jug with a buff surface and similar painted decoration is published as Cypro-Phoenician (Folio Fine Art Ltd, cat. 50 (Dec. 1967), no. 144). The vessel is erroneously attributed to the site of Yeri-Phoenikiais in CVA 1, pl. 6.10. The shape resembles that of Swedish Cyprus Expedition Groups V and VI, both decorated and Plain White wares but the painted decoration cannot be paralleled in these groups (see SCE IV/2 passim).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (HB.01)
CVA British Museum 1 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 1, British Museum 1 (pl. 6.10)
